intro: Conyza amplectens, commonly known as the common blueweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and has opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, blue or purple flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution. Conyza amplectens is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
